segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 22
segments.en: Linked Discourses 22

segments.pli: 10. Pupphavagga
segments.en: 10. Flowers

segments.pli: 96. Gomayapiṇḍasutta
segments.en: 96. A Lump of Cow Dung

segments.pli: Sāvatthinidānaṃ.
segments.en: At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Seated to one side, that mendicant said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “atthi nu kho, bhante, kiñci rūpaṃ yaṃ rūpaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ sassatisamaṃ tatheva ṭhassati?
segments.en: “Sir, is there any form at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever?

segments.pli: Atthi nu kho, bhante, kāci vedanā yā vedanā niccā dhuvā sassatā avipariṇāmadhammā sassatisamaṃ tatheva ṭhassati?
segments.en: Is there any feeling …

segments.pli: Atthi nu kho, bhante, kāci saññā yā saññā … pe …
segments.en: perception …

segments.pli: atthi nu kho, bhante, keci saṅkhārā ye saṅkhārā niccā dhuvā sassatā avipariṇāmadhammā sassatisamaṃ tatheva ṭhassanti?
segments.en: choices …

segments.pli: Atthi nu kho, bhante, kiñci viññāṇaṃ, yaṃ viññāṇaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ sassatisamaṃ tatheva ṭhassatī”ti?
segments.en: consciousness at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever?”

segments.pli: “Natthi kho, bhikkhu, kiñci rūpaṃ, yaṃ rūpaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ sassatisamaṃ tatheva ṭhassati.
segments.en: “Mendicant, there is no form at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever.

segments.pli: Natthi kho, bhikkhu, kāci vedanā …
segments.en: There’s no feeling …

segments.pli: kāci saññā …
segments.en: perception …

segments.pli: keci saṅkhārā …
segments.en: choices …

segments.pli: kiñci viññāṇaṃ, yaṃ viññāṇaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ sassatisamaṃ tatheva ṭhassatī”ti.
segments.en: consciousness at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever.”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ gomayapiṇḍaṃ pāṇinā gahetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the Buddha, picking up a lump of cow dung, said to the mendicants:

segments.pli: “ettakopi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho natthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tatheva ṭhassati.
segments.en: “There’s not even this much of any incarnation that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever.

segments.pli: Ettako cepi, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho abhavissa nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, nayidaṃ brahmacariyavāso paññāyetha sammā dukkhakkhayāya.
segments.en: If there were, this living of the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering would not be found.

segments.pli: Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhu, ettakopi attabhāvapaṭilābho natthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, tasmā brahmacariyavāso paññāyati sammā dukkhakkhayāya.
segments.en: But since there isn’t, this living of the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering is found.

segments.pli: Bhūtapubbāhaṃ, bhikkhu, rājā ahosiṃ khattiyo muddhāvasitto.
segments.en: Once upon a time I was an anointed aristocratic king.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddhāvasittassa caturāsītinagarasahassāni ahesuṃ kusāvatīrājadhānippamukhāni.
segments.en: I had 84,000 cities, with the capital Kusāvatī the foremost.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddhāvasittassa caturāsītipāsādasahassāni ahesuṃ dhammapāsādappamukhāni.
segments.en: I had 84,000 palaces, with the palace named Principle the foremost.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddhāvasittassa caturāsītikūṭāgārasahassāni ahesuṃ mahābyūhakūṭāgārappamukhāni.
segments.en: I had 84,000 chambers, with the great foyer the foremost.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddhāvasittassa caturāsītipallaṅkasahassāni ahesuṃ dantamayāni sāramayāni sovaṇṇamayāni goṇakatthatāni paṭikatthatāni paṭalikatthatāni kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇāni sauttaracchadāni ubhatolohitakūpadhānāni.
segments.en: I had 84,000 couches made of ivory or heartwood or gold or silver, spread with woolen covers—shag-piled or embroidered with flowers—and spread with a fine deer hide, with a canopy above and red pillows at both ends.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddhāvasittassa caturāsītināgasahassāni ahesuṃ sovaṇṇālaṅkārāni sovaṇṇaddhajāni hemajālapaṭicchannāni uposathanāgarājappamukhāni.
segments.en: I had 84,000 bull elephants with gold adornments and banners, covered with gold netting, with the royal bull elephant named Sabbath the foremost.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddhāvasittassa caturāsītiassasahassāni ahesuṃ sovaṇṇālaṅkārāni sovaṇṇaddhajāni hemajālapaṭicchannāni valāhakaassarājappamukhāni.
segments.en: I had 84,000 horses with gold adornments and banners, covered with gold netting, with the royal steed named Thundercloud the foremost.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddhāvasittassa caturāsītirathasahassāni ahesuṃ sovaṇṇālaṅkārāni sovaṇṇaddhajāni hemajālapaṭicchannāni vejayantarathappamukhāni.
segments.en: I had 84,000 chariots with gold adornments and banners, covered with gold netting, with the chariot named Triumph the foremost.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddhāvasittassa caturāsītimaṇisahassāni ahesuṃ maṇiratanappamukhāni.
segments.en: I had 84,000 jewels, with the jewel-treasure the foremost.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu … pe … caturāsītiitthisahassāni ahesuṃ subhaddādevippamukhāni.
segments.en: I had 84,000 women, with Queen Subhaddā the foremost.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu … pe … caturāsītikhattiyasahassāni ahesuṃ anuyantāni pariṇāyakaratanappamukhāni.
segments.en: I had 84,000 aristocrat vassals, with the counselor-treasure the foremost.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu … pe … caturāsītidhenusahassāni ahesuṃ dukūlasandānāni kaṃsūpadhāraṇāni.
segments.en: I had 84,000 milk cows with silken reins and bronze pails.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu … pe … caturāsītivatthakoṭisahassāni ahesuṃ khomasukhumāni koseyyasukhumāni kambalasukhumāni kappāsikasukhumāni.
segments.en: I had 8,400,000,000 fine cloths of linen, silk, wool, and cotton.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu … pe … caturāsītithālipākasahassāni ahesuṃ; sāyaṃ pātaṃ bhattābhihāro abhihariyittha.
segments.en: I had 84,000 servings of food, which were presented to me as offerings in the morning and evening.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā nagarasahassānaṃ ekaññeva taṃ nagaraṃ hoti yamahaṃ tena samayena ajjhāvasāmi—kusāvatī rājadhānī.
segments.en: Of those 84,000 cities, I only stayed in one, the capital Kusāvatī.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā pāsādasahassānaṃ ekoyeva so pāsādo hoti yamahaṃ tena samayena ajjhāvasāmi—dhammo pāsādo.
segments.en: Of those 84,000 mansions, I only dwelt in one, the Palace of Principle.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā kūṭāgārasahassānaṃ ekaññeva taṃ kūṭāgāraṃ hoti yamahaṃ tena samayena ajjhāvasāmi—mahābyūhaṃ kūṭāgāraṃ.
segments.en: Of those 84,000 chambers, I only dwelt in the great foyer.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā pallaṅkasahassānaṃ ekoyeva so pallaṅko hoti yamahaṃ tena samayena paribhuñjāmi—dantamayo vā sāramayo vā sovaṇṇamayo vā rūpiyamayo vā.
segments.en: Of those 84,000 couches, I only used one, made of ivory or heartwood or gold or silver.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā nāgasahassānaṃ ekoyeva so nāgo hoti yamahaṃ tena samayena abhiruhāmi—uposatho nāgarājā.
segments.en: Of those 84,000 bull elephants, I only rode one, the royal bull elephant named Sabbath.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā assasahassānaṃ ekoyeva so asso hoti yamahaṃ tena samayena abhiruhāmi—valāhako assarājā.
segments.en: Of those 84,000 horses, I only rode one, the royal horse named Thundercloud.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā rathasahassānaṃ ekoyeva so ratho hoti yamahaṃ tena samayena abhiruhāmi—vejayanto ratho.
segments.en: Of those 84,000 chariots, I only rode one, the chariot named Triumph.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā itthisahassānaṃ ekāyeva sā itthī hoti yā maṃ tena samayena paccupaṭṭhāti—khattiyānī vā velāmikā vā.
segments.en: Of those 84,000 women, I was only served by one, a maiden of the aristocratic or merchant classes.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā vatthakoṭisahassānaṃ ekaññeva taṃ vatthayugaṃ hoti yamahaṃ tena samayena paridahāmi—khomasukhumaṃ vā koseyyasukhumaṃ vā kambalasukhumaṃ vā kappāsikasukhumaṃ vā.
segments.en: Of those 8,400,000,000 cloths, I only wore one pair, made of fine linen, silk, wool, or cotton.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā thālipākasahassānaṃ ekoyeva so thālipāko hoti yato nāḷikodanaparamaṃ bhuñjāmi tadupiyañca sūpeyyaṃ.
segments.en: Of those 84,000 servings of food, I only had one, eating at most a serving of rice and suitable sauce.

segments.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhu, sabbe te saṅkhārā atītā niruddhā vipariṇatā.
segments.en: And so all those conditioned phenomena have passed, ceased, and perished.

segments.pli: Evaṃ aniccā kho, bhikkhu, saṅkhārā.
segments.en: So impermanent are conditions,

segments.pli: Evaṃ addhuvā kho, bhikkhu, saṅkhārā.
segments.en: so unstable are conditions,

segments.pli: Evaṃ anassāsikā kho, bhikkhu, saṅkhārā.
segments.en: so unreliable are conditions.

segments.pli: Yāvañcidaṃ, bhikkhu, alameva sabbasaṅkhāresu nibbindituṃ, alaṃ virajjituṃ, alaṃ vimuccitun”ti.
segments.en: This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed regarding all conditions.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Nothing in the aggregates has even the tiniest bit of stability or permanence. In a past life, the Buddha was a great king with vast properties, but all those conditions have passed away.
